headline: Venezuela oil: Energy giants likely to invest in infrastructure
summary: Oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) are rising Monday morning following President Trump's ousting of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro over the weekend. Energy giants are already looking to invest billions of dollars into reviving Venezuela's oil market and rebuilding its oil infrastructure. Hedgeye Risk Management energy analyst Fernando Valle lists the operators and refiners, like Chevron (CVX) and Exxon Mobil (XOM), who would have so much to gain from this opportunity. China — one of Venezuela's biggest trade allies for oil — has condemned the invasion. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Oil stocks sharply higher after US action in Venezuela
summary: Shares of major U.S. companies in the energy sector are sharply higher Monday after President Donald Trump announced plans to take control of Venezuela’s oil industry, saying that it would be American companies helping to revitalize it following the capture of President Nicolás Maduro.  While the U.S. action is unlikely to have an immediate impact on crude prices given the current glut in the market, it could upend energy markets and have an impact on the geopolitical landscape.  U.S. control of the Venezuelan energy industry, which sits on the world’s largest oil reserves, could “reshape the balance of power in international energy markets,” analysts with JP Morgan wrote Monday.

raw.headline: Oil stocks sharply higher after US action in Venezuela
raw.summary: Shares of major U.S. companies in the energy sector are sharply higher Monday after President Donald Trump announced plans to take control of Venezuela’s oil industry, saying that it would be American companies helping to revitalize it following the capture of President Nicolás Maduro.  While the U.S. action is unlikely to have an immediate impact on crude prices given the current glut in the market, it could upend energy markets and have an impact on the geopolitical landscape.  U.S. control of the Venezuelan energy industry, which sits on the world’s largest oil reserves, could “reshape the balance of power in international energy markets,” analysts with JP Morgan wrote Monday.

headline: Trump’s Venezuela Oil Revival Plan Is a $100 Billion Gamble
summary: Rebuilding it enough to lift Venezuela’s output back to its peak levels of the 1970s would require companies to invest about $10 billion per year over the next decade, said Francisco Monaldi, director of Latin American energy policy at Rice University’s Baker Institute for Public Policy.  Venezuela sits atop the world’s largest oil reserves.  US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said during an interview with ABC Sunday that he expects US oil companies will be eager for the opportunity to drill for Venezuela’s heavy crude, which is key for refineries on the US Gulf Coast.

raw.headline: Trump’s Venezuela Oil Revival Plan Is a $100 Billion Gamble
raw.summary: Rebuilding it enough to lift Venezuela’s output back to its peak levels of the 1970s would require companies to invest about $10 billion per year over the next decade, said Francisco Monaldi, director of Latin American energy policy at Rice University’s Baker Institute for Public Policy.  Venezuela sits atop the world’s largest oil reserves.  US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said during an interview with ABC Sunday that he expects US oil companies will be eager for the opportunity to drill for Venezuela’s heavy crude, which is key for refineries on the US Gulf Coast.

headline: How Venezuela’s Post-Maduro Oil Opening At Exxon Mobil (XOM) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: In recent days, U.S. military action in Venezuela and the capture of President Nicolás Maduro have prompted Washington to invite major American oil companies, including Exxon Mobil, to potentially invest billions of US dollars to rehabilitate the country’s damaged oil infrastructure over the coming years. For Exxon Mobil, the episode highlights how geopolitical shifts can open long-lead, high-capital upstream options in frontier regions, even as immediate decisions are constrained by...
